clauses.clause_text: The Contractor shall not sublet the whole of the Works. Except in the case of subcontracts to Nominated Subcontractors and except in any case where the Contract specifically permits subcontracting, the Contractor shall not sublet any part of the Works (whether that part involves the carrying out of any work or the provision of any Plant or a combination of such activities) without the prior written consent of the Project Manager and the Supervision Consultant and only (such prior written consent having been obtained) upon such terms as the Project Manager may require. The Contractor shall obtain the prior written consent of the Project Managerand the Supervision Consultant to proposed Subcontractors. The Contractor shall give the Project Manager not less than twenty eight (28) days' notice of the intended date of the commencement of each Subcontractor's work and of the commencement of such work on the Site. No subcontract whether with a Nominated Subcontractor, a Subcontractor to whom the Contract specifically permits subcontracting or a Subcontractor to whose subcontract the Project Manager and the Supervision Consultant have given prior written consent shall relieve the Contractor from any liability or obligation under the Contract and the Contractor shall be responsible for the acts, defaults and neglects of each Subcontractor, its agents or employees as fully as if they were the acts, defaults or neglects of the Contractor, its agents or employees. The Contractor shall be responsible for the observance by all Subcontractors of all the provisions of the Contract. Every subcontract shall contain a prohibition on assignment in the same terms as Clause 3.1 (Assignment) and a total prohibition on subletting the whole of the works covered thereby and a prohibition on subletting any part of the works covered thereby without the prior written consent of the Project Manager and the Supervision Consultant.

clauses.clause_text:
(a) The Contract has been prepared and agreed in the Ruling Language
and all documents delivered thereunder or in connection therewith
(including without limitation all correspondence, drawings,
specifications, notices, certificates, instructions, orders, decisions,
determinations, consents, approvals and other documents submitted
to any of the Employer, the Project Manager, the Supervision
Consultant or the Contractor) shall also be in the Ruling Language.
In the event of any translation of the Contract or any part thereof or
of any such documents as aforesaid into any other language, the
same shall continue to be construed and interpreted according to the
Ruling Language version which shall (to the extent allowed by law)
therefore prevail in the event of any conflict. If, notwithstanding the
foregoing, any competent court should hold that any such other
translation shall prevail over the relevant Ruling Language version,
that Ruling Language version shall be referred to in order to assist in
interpretation of the other translation.

(b) The Contractor shall at its own Cost comply with such language
requirements as may from time to time be applicable to dealings
between the Contractor and any governmental ministry, department,
authority, corporation or municipality.

(c) All the Contractor's and Subcontractors' superintending and
technical personnel working in connection with the performance of
the Works shall be fluent in the Ruling Language.

(a) The Contractor shall comply with all applicable rules, regulations and
procedures relating to safety matters in its access arrangements and
Site operations.
(b) Without prejudice to any other obligations under the Contract the
Contractor shall take full responsibility for the supervision, adequacy,
stability and safety of all Site operations, of all methods of execution
and of all the Works, irrespective of any approval or consent by the
Supervision Consultant or the Project Manager.
(c) When working on the Site, any area for the time being occupied by
the Employer or any area designated by the Project Manager the
Contractor shall strictly observe and perform each and every
provision of the Employer's and the Project Manager’s rules,
regulations and procedures relating to safety matters for the time
being in force.
(d) The Contractor shall take all necessary steps to protect the
environment (both on and off the Site) and to avoid damage and
nuisance to people and property resulting from pollution, noise and
other results of its operations. This shall include the Contractor
providing temporary roadways, footways, guards and fences which
may be rendered necessary, by reason of the carrying out of the
Works, for the use and protection of the public and of owners and
occupiers of adjacent land. The Contractor shall ensure that
emissions, surface discharges and effluent from the Contractor's
activities shall not exceed the values indicated in the Contract and
shall not exceed the values prescribed by the applicable laws.
(e) The Contractor shall not interfere with:
(i) the convenience of the public, or

footpaths, irrespective of whether they are public or in the
possession of the Employer or of others.

against and from all damages, losses and expenses (including legal
fees and expenses) resulting from any such interference

clauses.clause_text:
The Contractor shall be responsible for the accurate setting-out of the
Works in relation to original points, lines, levels of reference and bench¬
marks given or prescribed by the Supervision Consultant in writing and for
the correctness of the positions, levels, dimensions and alignment of all
parts of the Works and for the provision of all necessary instruments,
appliances and labour in connection therewith. Before commencing the
carrying out of the Works, the Contractor shall satisfy itself as to such
original points, lines, levels of reference and bench-marks and shall give
notice to the Project Manager (with a copy to the Supervision Consultant) of
any error in such original points, lines, levels of reference and bench-marks.
After receipt of any such notice, the Project Manager shall arrange for the
Supervision Consultant to rectify such error and the Supervision Consultant
shall then instruct the Contractor thereon. If, at any time during the
progress of the Works, any error shall appear or arise in the positions,
levels, dimensions or alignment of any part of the Works, the Contractor, on
being required so to do by the Supervision Consultant, shall, at its own Cost,
rectify such error to the satisfaction of the Supervision Consultant. The
checking of any setting out or of any line or level by the Supervision
Consultant shall not in any way relieve the Contractor of its responsibility for
the accuracy and correctness thereof. The Contractor shall carefully protect
and preserve all bench-marks, sight-rails, pegs and other things used in
setting-out the Works

connection with the Works, or any part thereof, either during the carrying out
of the Works or during the Defects Liability Period (or to, in or in connection
with any part of the Works the subject of an Extended Warranty, during its
extension beyond the Defects Liability Period), any remedial or other work
or repair shall, in the opinion of the Supervision Consultant or the Project
Manager, be urgently necessary for the safety of the Works and the
Contractor is unable or unwilling at once to do such work or repair, the
Employer may itself and/or may employ any other contractor or contractors
to carry out such work or repair (at the Contractor's risk) as the Supervision
Consultant or the Project Manager may consider necessary. If the work or
repair so carried out is work or repair which, in the opinion of the Project
Manager, the Contractor was liable to do at its own Cost under the Contract,
all Costs incurred by the Employer in so doing as determined by the Project
Manager shall be recoverable from the Contractor by the Employer as a
debt due from the Contractor, or may be deducted by the Employer from any
monies due or which may become due to the Contractor. Provided always
that the Project Manager shall, as soon after the occurrence of any such
emergency as maybe reasonably practicable, notify the Contractor thereof

clean and safe condition to the reasonable satisfaction of the Project
Manager and shall from time to time clear away and remove from the Site all
rubbish, wreckage, surplus Plant and any Contractor's Equipment no longer
required for the carrying out of the Works and the remedying of defects
therein. If the Contractor shall fail to comply with these obligations within  forty eight (48) hours after written notice from the Project Manager
specifying the failure then (without prejudice to any other remedy) the
Employer may itself and/or may employ any other contractor or contractors
to take such action (at the Contractor's risk) in regard to such obligations as
the Project Manager considers necessary. The Costs incurred by the
Employer in regard to such action shall be determined by the Project
Manager and the Employer may deduct the Costs incurred from any monies
due or which may become due to the Contractor or recover the same as a
debt due from the Contractor.

deemed to be intended exclusively for the carrying out of the Works and the
remedying of defects therein. No Plant shall be removed from the Site
without the prior written consent of the Project Manager but this shall not be
refused if in the Supervision Consultant's opinion:-
(a) the relevant Plant is not in accordance with the Contract and it is
necessary to remove the same for the purpose of modification or
replacement; or
(b) the relevant Plant is surplus to the requirements of the Works.
The Contractor shall not remove any Contractor's Equipment from the Site
without the prior written consent of the Project Manager but this shall not be
refused if in the Project Manager's opinion the relevant item is no longer
required for the carrying out of the Works and the remedying of defects
therein.

clauses.clause_text:
The Contractor shall at all times take all necessary precautions to maintain
the health and safety of the Contractor's employees.
The Contractor shall appoint a full time Safety Officer at the Site,
responsible on behalf of the Contractor for maintaining the safety, and
protection against accidents, of all persons on the Site and its surroundings.
The Safety Officer shall be qualified for this responsibility, shall report
directly to the Contractor's Representative and shall have the authority to
issue instructions and to take protective measures to prevent accidents.
Throughout the carrying out of the Works, the Contractor shall provide
whatever is required by the Safety Officer to exercise this responsibility and
authority.

The Contractor shall send to the Project Manager, with a copy to the
Employer, details of any accident as soon as practicable after its
occurrence. In the case of any fatality or serious accident, the Contractor
shall, in addition, notify the Project Manager and the Employer immediately
by the quickest available means. The Contractor shall maintain such
records and make such reports concerning health, safety and welfare of
persons, and damage to property, as the Project Manager or the Employer
may from time to time require.
In the event of any outbreak of illness of an epidemic nature, the Contractor
shall comply with and carry out such regulations, orders and requirements
as may be made by the Government, or the local medical or sanitary
authorities for the purpose of dealing with and overcoming the same.
clauses.general_condition:
The Contractor shall at all times take all necessary precautions to maintain
the health and safety of the Contractor's employees.
The Contractor shall appoint a full time Safety Officer at the Site,
responsible on behalf of the Contractor for maintaining the safety, and
protection against accidents, of all persons on the Site and its surroundings.
The Safety Officer shall be qualified for this responsibility, shall report
directly to the Contractor's Representative and shall have the authority to
issue instructions and to take protective measures to prevent accidents.
Throughout the carrying out of the Works, the Contractor shall provide
whatever is required by the Safety Officer to exercise this responsibility and
authority.

The Contractor shall send to the Project Manager, with a copy to the
Employer, details of any accident as soon as practicable after its
occurrence. In the case of any fatality or serious accident, the Contractor
shall, in addition, notify the Project Manager and the Employer immediately
by the quickest available means. The Contractor shall maintain such
records and make such reports concerning health, safety and welfare of
persons, and damage to property, as the Project Manager or the Employer
may from time to time require.
In the event of any outbreak of illness of an epidemic nature, the Contractor
shall comply with and carry out such regulations, orders and requirements
as may be made by the Government, or the local medical or sanitary
authorities for the purpose of dealing with and overcoming the same.

connection with the carrying out of the Works and the remedying of defects
therein all such qualified and experienced superintending and technical staff
and all such skilled, semi-skilled and unskilled labour as may be necessary
for the performance and discharge by the Contractor of all its obligations
under the Contract with skill, care and diligence and within the required time
all as provided herein. The Contractor shall not recruit, or attempt to recruit,
his staff and labour from amongst persons in the service of the Employer,
the Project Manager or the Supervision Consultant. The Employer and the
Project Manager shall individually be at liberty to object to and require the
Contractor to remove (or cause to be removed) forthwith from the Site any
person employed by the Contractor in or about the carrying out of the Works
or the remedying of defects therein who, in the opinion of the Employer or
the Project Manager, misconducts himself, or is incompetent or negligent in
the proper performance of his duties, or fails to conform with any provisions
of the Contract, or conducts himself in a manner which is prejudicial to
safety, health or the protection of the environment, or whose employment is
otherwise considered by the Employer or the Project Manager to be
undesirable; and such person shall not be again employed upon the Works
without the prior written permission of the Employer and the Project
Manager. If appropriate, the Contractor shall then provide and employ (or
cause to be employed) a suitable replacement person. Such removal and
subsequent replacement shall be at the Contractor's Costand no extension
of time shall be granted to the Contractor for any delay which has been or
may be caused by such removal and any such replacement. The Contractor
shall comply with all relevant labour laws applicable to its employees
including without limitation laws relating to their employment, health, safety,
welfare, immigration and emigration and shall allow them all their legal
rights. The Contractor shall require its employees to comply with all
applicable laws, statues, ordinances and other laws, other provisions having the force of law, bye-laws and regulations, including those concerning safety
at work.

clauses.clause_text: (a) The Contractor shall be fully and exclusively liable for the payment of all salaries, wages and other remuneration and benefits of every kind which may become due to or payable in respect of all persons employed by the Contractor in connection with the carrying out and completion of the Works and the remedying of defects therein, and for the provision to such persons of all housing, transportation, feeding and support services. In the event of any failure by the Contractor to carry out in full its obligations under this Sub-Clause 10.4(a), the Employer may (without prejudice to any other rights) itself make such payment or provision as aforesaid and deduct the Cost thereof as determined by the Project Manager from any monies due or which may become due to the Contractor or recover the same as a debt due from the Contractor. (b) The Contractor shall pay rates of wages, and observe conditions of labour, which are not lower than those established for the trade or industry where the work is carried out. If no established rates or conditions are applicable, the Contractor shall pay rates of wages and observe conditions which are not lower than the general level of wages and conditions observed locally by employers whose trade or industry is similar to that of the Contractor.

clauses.clause_text: The Contractor shall give to the Project Manager (with a copy to the Supervision Consultant) not less than fourteen (14) days' prior written notice of its readiness to carry out any test and shall agree with the Project Manager and the Supervision Consultant the date, time and place at which the same is to be carried out. The Contractor shall carry out such test on the date and at the time and place agreed. If the Contractor fails to carry out any such test on the date and at the time and place so agreed, any additional Costs consequently incurred by the Employer as determined by the Project Manager may be deducted by the Employer from any monies due or which may become due to the Contractor or the Employer may recover the same from the Contractor as a debt due from the Contractor. After carrying out any test the Contractor shall forthwith forward to the Project Manager (with a copy to the Supervision Consultant) a duly certified report of the test results. The provisions of this Clause 11.5 shall not apply to Tests on Completion, to which the provisions of Clause 19A.1 (Time for Tests) shall apply.

clauses.clause_text: If at any time the Supervision Consultant shall as a result of any inspection, examination, measurement and/or test decide that any workmanship and/or Plant (including materials for the manufacture or fabrication thereof and/or samples of such materials) is defective or otherwise not in accordance with the Contract he shall, notwithstanding any earlier inspection, examination, measurement and/or test or any interim payment, have power to order the Contractor in writing to:- (a) make good the defect or otherwise take such steps as may be necessary to ensure that the workmanship or Plant complies with the Contract; and/or (b) remove from the Site, within such time as may be specified in the order, any Plant which in his opinion is defective or otherwise not in accordance with the Contract and substitute proper and suitable Plant; and the Contractor shall comply with any such order in a timely manner and at its sole Cost. Thereafter the Supervision Consultant may require any relevant testing to be repeated and may stipulate a reasonable period, having regard to the requirements of the Programme, within which such repeated testing must be carried out and completed. The Cost of such repeated testing shall be borne by the Contractor and any Costs which the Employer may incur as a result of the repetition of such testing shall be determined by the Project Manager and the Employer may deduct the Costs so incurred from any monies due or which may become due to the Contractor or recover the same from the Contractor as a debt due from the Contractor. The provisions contained in Clause 11.4 (Cost of Testing) shall apply to such repeat testing. If the Contractor should default in carrying out any such order of the Supervision Consultant or any relevant repeated testing (within any such period stipulated by the Supervision Consultant) the Supervision Consultant may require, the Employer shall (without prejudice to any other rights the Employer may have by virtue of the said default) be entitled to employ and pay any other person or persons to carry out the same at the Contractor's risk and all Costs consequent thereon or incidental thereto shall be determined by the Project Manager and the Employer may deduct the Costs so incurred from any monies due or which may become due to the Contractor or recover the same as a debt due from the Contractor. The provisions of this Clause 11.7 shall not apply to Tests on Completion, to which the provisions of Clause 19A.4 (Repeat Tests and Rejection) shall apply

clauses.clause_text: In the event of any claim being made against or any proceedings being brought against the Employer, which claim or proceedings are within the scope of the indemnity contained in Clause 14.1 (Indemnity), the Contractor shall be promptly notified in writing by the Employer and may at its own Cost conduct all negotiations for the settlement of the same and any litigation that may arise therefrom. The Employer shall not, unless and until the Contractor shall have failed to take over the conduct of the negotiations or litigation, within a reasonable time after having been so requested by the Employer, make any admission which might be prejudicial thereto. The conduct by the Contractor of such negotiations or litigation shall be conditional upon the Contractor having first given to the Employer such reasonable security as shall from time to time be required by the Employer to cover the amount ascertained or agreed or estimated, as the case may be, of any compensation, damages, losses, costs, expenses, royalties and fees which the Employer may incur or for which it may become liable. The Employer shall, at the request of the Contractor, afford all available assistance for the purpose of contesting any such claim or proceedings, and shall be repaid all reasonable Costs incurred in so doing.

Subcontractors and its and their employees and agents do not, at any time
hereafter whether before or after completion of the Works or termination of
the Contract, use or disclose to any person whomsoever or whatsoever:-

(a) any drawings, documents or other information, whether written or
oral, which may be communicated to it or him or of which it or he
may otherwise become possessed or aware as a result of or in

(b) in particular (but without prejudice to the generality of paragraph (a)

Contract Sum, the Bills of Quantities or any other pricing or payment
matter under the Contract; or

(c) any other information, whether written or oral, relating to the
business, secrets, dealings, transactions or affairs of the Employer.

which the Contractor can conclusively demonstrate to the satisfaction of the

authorise the disclosure of information within paragraph (b) above save to
the Employer itself, the Project Manager, or the Contractor's own
professional advisers and accordingly (save in any such case) the specific
prior written consent of the Employer will be required.

clauses.clause_text:
(a) The Contractor shall use every reasonable means to prevent any of
the roads or bridges connecting with or on the routes to the Site from
being damaged or injured by any traffic for or in respect of the Works
and, in particular, shall select routes, choose and use vehicles and
restrict and distribute loads so that any extraordinary traffic which will
inevitably arise from the moving of Plant or Contractor's Equipment
from and to the Site shall be limited as far as possible, and so that
no unnecessary damage or injury may be occasioned to such roads
or bridges.

(b) The Contractor shall be responsible for and shall pay the Cost of
strengthening any bridges or altering or improving any road
connecting with or on the routes to the Site to facilitate the
movement of Plant or Contractor's Equipment. Whenever the
Contractor receives a claim for damage or injury to any such road or
bridge it shall immediately report the same to the Project Manager in
writing. The Contractor shall indemnify and keep indemnified the
Employer against all claims for damage or injury to any such road or
bridge caused by or arising from such movement, including such
claims as may be made directly against the Employer, and shall
negotiate and pay all claims, proceedings, damages, costs and
charges in relation thereto.

clauses.clause_text:
The Contractor shall be deemed to have satisfied itself prior to submitting its
Tender as to the suitability and availability of access routes to the Site.
Subject to any provision to the contrary contained in the Contract:-

(a) the Contractor shall (as between the Employer and the Contractor)
be responsible for and shall pay the Cost of any maintenance which
may be required for its use of access routes;

(b) the Contractor shall at its own Cost provide all necessary signs or
directions along access routes and shall obtain any permission
which may be required from the relevant authorities for its use of
routes, signs and directions;



(c) the Employer shall not be responsible for any claims which may arise
from the use or otherwise by the Contractor of any access route;

(d) the Employer does not guarantee the suitability or availability of
particular access routes; and

(e) Costs incurred due to the non-suitability or non-availability of access
routes shall be borne by the Contractor.

clauses.clause_text: If the Works or any part thereof is the subject of a Suspension Order and if written permission (bearing the written consent of the Employer) to resume work is not given by the Project Manager within a period of ninety (90) days from the date of suspension then, unless such suspension is within any of paragraphs (a) to (d) inclusive of Clause 18.1 (Suspension Order), the Contractor may serve a written notice on the Project Manager requiring permission within twenty eight (28) days from the receipt thereof to proceed with the Works or that part thereof the subject of the Suspension Order and, if such permission is not within that time granted by the Project Manager in writing and bearing the written consent of the Employer, the Contractor by a further written notice so served may, but is not bound to, elect to treat the suspension where it affects part only of the Works as an omission of such part pursuant to a Variation Order under Clause 22.1 (Variation Orders), or, where it affects the whole of the Works, as a termination of the Contract by the Employer for its convenience under Clause 31.1 (Termination for Convenience) thereby giving the Contractor the rights conferred by Clause 31.3 (Payment on Termination).

clauses.clause_text:
The Contractor shall carry out the Tests on Completion in accordance with
the Contract to the satisfaction of the Supervision Consultant. The
Contractor shall give to the Project Manager, (with a copy to the Supervision
Consultant), not less than fourteen (14) days' prior written notice of the date
after which the Contractor will be ready to commence the Tests on
Completion for any Section or Portion of the Works. Unless otherwise
agreed between the Project Manager, Supervision Consultant and the
Contractor, the Tests on Completion shall commence within ten (10) days
after the said date on such day and at such time as the Supervision
Consultant shall notify the Contractor in writing and the Tests on Completion
shall thereafter be carried out continuously until completed. If the
Supervision Consultant fails so to notify the Contractor or to attend at the
time so notified the Contractor may nevertheless commence and carry out
the Tests on Completion which shall be deemed to have been made in the
Supervision Consultant's presence. After each of the Tests on Completion
has itself been completed the Contractor shall forthwith forward to the
Project Manager (with a copy to the Supervision Consultant) duly certified
copies of the test results.

Contractor shall give to the Project Manager, (with a copy to the Supervision

after which the Contractor will be ready to commence the Tests on
Completion for any Section or Portion of the Works. Unless otherwise
agreed between the Project Manager, Supervision Consultant and the
Contractor, the Tests on Completion shall commence within ten (10) days
after the said date on such day and at such time as the Supervision

clauses.clause_text:
If in the opinion of the Supervision Consultant the commencement or
continuation of the Tests on Completion for any Section or Portion of the
Works is being unduly delayed, the Supervision Consultant may, by notice
in writing, call upon the Contractor to commence or recommence such Tests
within twenty one (21) days from the receipt of the said notice, and the
Contractor shall commence or recommence the said Tests on such day and
at such time within the said twenty one (21) days as the Contractor may fix
and of which it shall give not less than three (3) days' prior written notice to
the Project Manager (with a copy to the Supervision Consultant) and the
Contractor shall thereafter carry out the said Tests continuously until
completed. If the Contractor fails to commence or recommence such Tests
within the aforesaid period (without prejudice to the Employer's rights
against the Contractor in respect of such failure) the Employer shall (without
prejudice to any other remedy) be entitled to employ and pay any other
person or persons to commence or recommence the Tests on such day and
at such time as the Project Manager may notify to the Contractor in writing
and the Employer may thereafter arrange for such other person or persons
to carry out such Tests until completed but no such testing by such other
person or persons shall in any way relieve the Contractor from any of its
obligations or liabilities under the Contract save for carrying out the
particular Test or Tests concerned if and to the extent that the results
thereof show the same to have been duly passed to the satisfaction of the
Supervision Consultant. Neither the Employer nor such other person or
persons shall incur any liability whatsoever to the Contractor as a result of
or in connection with the carrying out of any such Tests by such other
person or persons except insofar as the Contractor may be able to prove
that such other person or persons caused deliberate damage or were guilty
of gross negligence. The carrying out of any such Tests by such other
person or persons shall be deemed to have been carried out in the
presence of the Contractor and the result of such Tests shall be accepted
as accurate.

clauses.clause_text:
If the results of any Tests on Completion for any Section or Portion of the
Works show the same not to have been duly passed to the satisfaction of
the Supervision Consultant, he may, notwithstanding any earlier inspection,
examination and/or test or any interim payment:-

(a) order the Contractor in writing to repeat the Test or Tests concerned;
and/or

(b) order the Contractor in writing to take at the Contractor's Cost all
such steps as maybe necessary to ensure that the relevant Section
or Portion of the Works complies with the Contract in all respects
and is capable of meeting any performance guarantees which the
Contract may contain. The aforesaid steps may, without limitation,
include the removal from Site of any Plant which in the Supervision
Consultant's opinion is defective or otherwise not in accordance with
the Contract and the substitution of proper and suitable Plant.

If the Contractor should default in carrying out any such order of the
Supervision Consultant as is referred to in paragraphs (a) or (b) above, then
(without prejudice to any other rights the Employer may have by virtue of the
said default) the Employer shall be entitled to employ and pay any other
person or persons to carry out the same at the Contractor's risk and all
Costs consequent thereon or incidental thereto shall be determined by the
Project Manager and the Employer may deduct the Costs so incurred from
any monies due or which may become due to the Contractor or recover the
same as a debt due from the Contractor.

(a) order the Contractor in writing to repeat the Test or Tests concerned;
and/or

(b) order the Contractor in writing to take at the Contractor's Cost all
such steps as maybe necessary to ensure that the relevant Section
or Portion of the Works complies with the Contract in all respects
and is capable of meeting any performance guarantees which the
Contract may contain. The aforesaid steps may, without limitation,
include the removal from Site of any Plant which in the Supervision
Consultant's opinion is defective or otherwise not in accordance with
the Contract and the substitution of proper and suitable Plant.

If the Contractor should default in carrying out any such order of the
Supervision Consultant as is referred to in paragraphs (a) or (b) above, then
(without prejudice to any other rights the Employer may have by virtue of the
said default) the Employer shall be entitled to employ and pay any other
person or persons to carry out the same at the Contractor's risk and all
Costs consequent thereon or incidental thereto shall be determined by the
Project Manager and the Employer may deduct the Costs so incurred from
any monies due or which may become due to the Contractor or recover the
same as a debt due from the Contractor.

clauses.clause_text: The Employer may from time to time during the currency of the Contract by written order (herein referred to as a "Variation Order") direct the Contractor to alter, amend, omit, add to or otherwise vary the Works or any part thereof or to change any sequence or timing of construction of any part of the Works specified in the Contract and the Contractor shall be bound to carry out such Variation Order as if the provisions of the same had been incorporated into the Contract. The Contractor shall not alter, amend, omit, add to or otherwise vary the Works or any part thereof or change any sequence or timing of construction of any part of the Works specified in- the Contract in any way whatsoever except as directed by a Variation Order. The effect, if any, of all such Variation Orders shall be valued in accordance with Clause 22.3 (Valuation of Variation Orders) provided that where the issue of a Variation Order is necessitated by some default of or breach of contract by the Contractor or for which it is responsible, any additional Costs attributable to such default or breach shall be borne by the Contractor.

clauses.clause_text: (a) The Employer may, if in his opinion it is necessary or desirable, issue an instruction that any varied work shall be carried out on a daywork basis. The Contractor shall then be paid for such varied work in accordance with the Dayworks Bill forming part of the Bills of Quantities and at the rates and prices stated in such Bill. (b) In respect of any part of the Works carried out on a daywork basis, the Contractor shall, during the continuance of such part of the Works, submit to the Project Manager each day in duplicate daywork sheets signed by the Contractor's Representative, in such form as the Project Manager shall require, giving the following details and such other details as the Project Manager may require: (i) a description of the work carried out; (ii) the name and occupation of and the hours properly and necessarily worked by all workmen employed in carrying out such work; (iii) a description of and the hours properly and necessarily worked by all plant and equipment used in carrying out such work; and a description and the quantity of all Plant properly and necessarily used in the carrying out of such work. The Project Manager shall arrange for the Supervision Consultant to consider such daywork sheets, to make any adjustments that the Supervision Consultant considers necessary and to thereafter sign one copy, adjusted as aforesaid, and return the said copy to the Contractor. (c) At the end of each month the Contractor shall submit to the Project Manager in duplicate statements signed by the Contractor's Representative, in such form as the Project Manager shall require, giving full details of any part of the Works carried out on a daywork basis during that month including but not limited to details of all workmen, Plant, plant and equipment used in carrying out such part of the Works and agreed by the Supervision Consultant in accordance with paragraph (b) of this Clause 22.4 such details being priced in accordance with the Dayworks Bill forming part of the Bills of Quantities. Such statements shall be accompanied by all relevant quotations, invoices, vouchers, receipts and any other documents and evidence which the Project Manager shall require in order to substantiate such statements. (d) The Contractor shall not be entitled to any payment for work carried out on a daywork basis unless the daywork sheets and statements and accompanying documents and evidence referred to in paragraphs (b) and (c) respectively of this Clause 22.4 have been fully and punctually rendered. Provided always that if the Employer considers that for any reason the sending of such daywork sheets and statements and accompanying documents and evidence by the Contractor in accordance with the said paragraphs was impracticable, he shall nevertheless be entitled to authorise payment for the relevant part of the Works, either on a daywork basis or at such value as shall, in his opinion, be fair and reasonable.

clauses.clause_text: The value of work done and/or Plant provided to which Provisional Sums relate shall be determined in accordance with the Bills of Quantities and the Particular Conditions and the Contractor shall be paid such value in accordance with Clause 26 (Interim and Final Certificates).
clauses.general_condition: The value of work done and/or Plant provided to which Provisional Sums relate shall be determined in accordance with the Bills of Quantities and the Particular Conditions and the Contractor shall be paid such value in accordance with Clause 26 (Interim and Final Certificates).

clauses.clause_text: In respect of each part of the Works (if any) covered by a Provisional Sum in the Bills of Quantities which is described therein as to be subject to competitive tendering as described in this Clause 22A.4, the following provisions shall apply to each such part of the Works. (a) The Contractor shall obtain competitive tenders from tenderers approved by the Employer. The Contractor shall in respect of each such part submit for the approval of the Employer a list of its proposed tenderers. The Contractor shall include in its lists of tenderers any firms proposed by the Employer. (b) The tender documents shall be prepared by the Contractor and shall be submitted to the Employer for review and comment (with the tender documents being amended by the Contractor to take into account any such comments) prior to issue by the Contractor to tenderers. Such tender documents shall advise tenderers that whilst tenders are to be addressed to the Contractor, they are to be delivered directly to the Employer in plain envelopes or parcels with wax seals marked for the attention of the Chairman of the Tender Committee and are not to be copied to the Contractor. Such tender documents shall include without limitation the provisions stated in the Particular Conditions as to be included in such documents. The Contractor shall provide the Employer with copies of any addenda, tender bulletins, tender circulars and the like in relation to such tender documents at the same time as they are issued by the Contractor to tenderers. (c) The tenders shall be opened in private by the Tender Committee of the Employer and a copy passed to the Contractor for evaluation. The Contractor shall submit its evaluation of both the technical and commercial aspects of the tenders to the Employer marked for the attention of the Chairman of the Tender Committee together with its recommendations as to the tenderer to be awarded the subcontract. Thereafter, the Contractor and, if required by the Employer, one or more of the tenderers, shall attend meetings with the Employer, the Project Manager and the Supervision Consultant to discuss the tenders and the Contractor shall provide any further details, documents and explanations as required by the Employer, the Project Manager or the Supervision Consultant. (d) Following the conclusion of the tender evaluation process, the Contractor shall obtain the written approval of the Employer to enter into a subcontract with the selected tenderer and following the receipt of such approval the Contractor shall enter into a subcontract with the approved tenderer. Provided that the Contractor shall submit the proposed subcontract documents to the Employer for review and comment and shall amend such document to take into account any such comments prior to entering into the said subcontract. The comments and approvals given by the Employer and the involvement of the Employer, the Project Manager and the Supervision Consultant in the tendering process pursuant to this Clause 22A.4 shall not release the Contractor from any of its obligations or liabilities under the Contract.

clauses.clause_text: As soon as the Contractor becomes aware of any particulars of or other information concerning any claim of which notice has been given to the Project Manager under Clause 23.1 (Notice of Claims) additional to the particulars and information contained in the aforesaid notice Or to any further particulars or information previously notified to the Project Manager under this Clause 23.2, the Contractor shall give notice in writing thereof to the Project Manager containing full details including without limitation any revision to the Contractor's previous estimate as to the amount of the aforesaid claim and details of the revision.
clauses.clause_title: Notice of Further Particulars or Information
clauses.general_condition: As soon as the Contractor becomes aware of any particulars of or other information concerning any claim of which notice has been given to the Project Manager under Clause 23.1 (Notice of Claims) additional to the particulars and information contained in the aforesaid notice Or to any further particulars or information previously notified to the Project Manager under this Clause 23.2, the Contractor shall give notice in writing thereof to the Project Manager containing full details including without limitation any revision to the Contractor's previous estimate as to the amount of the aforesaid claim and details of the revision.

clauses.clause_text: Whenever an event or circumstance occurs which gives rise to a claim as provided in Clause 23.1 (Notice of Claims) the Contractor shall keep full and detailed contemporary records of and relating to all matters relevant to any such claim either on the Site or at another location acceptable to the Project Manager. The Project Manager shall at any time during normal working hours of the Contractor be entitled to inspect such contemporary records and to require the Contractor to supply it with copies of any of the same.
clauses.general_condition: Whenever an event or circumstance occurs which gives rise to a claim as provided in Clause 23.1 (Notice of Claims) the Contractor shall keep full and detailed contemporary records of and relating to all matters relevant to any such claim either on the Site or at another location acceptable to the Project Manager. The Project Manager shall at any time during normal working hours of the Contractor be entitled to inspect such contemporary records and to require the Contractor to supply it with copies of any of the same.

clauses.clause_text: The Project Manager shall at any time or times be entitled to require the Contractor to deliver to the Project Manager in writing its then latest estimate as to the amount of any claim of which notice has been given to the Project Manager under Clause 23.1 (Notice of Claims).
clauses.general_condition: The Project Manager shall at any time or times be entitled to require the Contractor to deliver to the Project Manager in writing its then latest estimate as to the amount of any claim of which notice has been given to the Project Manager under Clause 23.1 (Notice of Claims).

clauses.clause_text: Within twenty eight (28) days, or such extended time as the Project Manager may allow, of giving notice under Clause 23.1 (Notice of Claims), the Contractor shall submit to the Project Manager a comprehensive account of the claim giving full and detailed particulars of and information concerning such claim. Such particulars and information shall without limitation include the grounds upon which the claim is based, the final amount of the claim and the build-up thereof and the contemporary records required under Clause 23.3 (Contemporary Records). Such particulars and information shall incorporate as applicable the particulars and information previously submitted under Clause 23.1 (Notice of Claims), Clause 23.2 (Notice of Further Particulars or Information) and Clause 23.3 (Contemporary Records). The Contractor shall thereafter promptly submit such further particulars and information of its claim as the Project Manager may require to assess the validity of the claim.
clauses.general_condition: Within twenty eight (28) days, or such extended time as the Project Manager may allow, of giving notice under Clause 23.1 (Notice of Claims), the Contractor shall submit to the Project Manager a comprehensive account of the claim giving full and detailed particulars of and information concerning such claim. Such particulars and information shall without limitation include the grounds upon which the claim is based, the final amount of the claim and the build-up thereof and the contemporary records required under Clause 23.3 (Contemporary Records). Such particulars and information shall incorporate as applicable the particulars and information previously submitted under Clause 23.1 (Notice of Claims), Clause 23.2 (Notice of Further Particulars or Information) and Clause 23.3 (Contemporary Records). The Contractor shall thereafter promptly submit such further particulars and information of its claim as the Project Manager may require to assess the validity of the claim.

clauses.clause_text: If the Contractor fails to comply with any of the provisions of Clause 23.1 (Notice of Claims) in respect of any such claim as is referred to therein, the Contractor shall not under any circumstances be entitled to any additional payment in respect of the claim concerned and the Employer shall be discharged from any and all liability in connection therewith. Otherwise, if the Contractor fails to comply with any of the provisions of Clause 23.2 (Notice of Further Particulars or Information), Clause 23.3 (Contemporary Records), Clause 23.4 (Current Estimates), Clause 23.5 (Comprehensive Claim) or any other Clauses of these Conditions of Contract which maybe applicable in respect of any such claim as is referred to therein, then (without prejudice to any other rights the Employer may have in respect of that failure) the Contractor shall be entitled to payment in respect of the claim concerned only to the extent that the Project Manager is not thereby prejudiced in fully investigating the claim and provided that the Contractor's entitlement to payment shall not exceed such amount as the Project Manager considers to be verified by contemporary records and is nevertheless able to establish that the same is fair and reasonable and should in accordance with the provisions of the Contract be paid by the Employer.
clauses.general_condition: If the Contractor fails to comply with any of the provisions of Clause 23.1 (Notice of Claims) in respect of any such claim as is referred to therein, the Contractor shall not under any circumstances be entitled to any additional payment in respect of the claim concerned and the Employer shall be discharged from any and all liability in connection therewith. Otherwise, if the Contractor fails to comply with any of the provisions of Clause 23.2 (Notice of Further Particulars or Information), Clause 23.3 (Contemporary Records), Clause 23.4 (Current Estimates), Clause 23.5 (Comprehensive Claim) or any other Clauses of these Conditions of Contract which maybe applicable in respect of any such claim as is referred to therein, then (without prejudice to any other rights the Employer may have in respect of that failure) the Contractor shall be entitled to payment in respect of the claim concerned only to the extent that the Project Manager is not thereby prejudiced in fully investigating the claim and provided that the Contractor's entitlement to payment shall not exceed such amount as the Project Manager considers to be verified by contemporary records and is nevertheless able to establish that the same is fair and reasonable and should in accordance with the provisions of the Contract be paid by the Employer.

clauses.clause_text: When the Project Manager has received the comprehensive account of the claim as required by Clause 23.5 (Comprehensive Claim) and such further particulars and information as he may require under such Clause, the Project Manager shall, after due consultation with the Employer, the Supervision Consultant and the Contractor, determine the amount, if any, to which the Contractor is entitled and the Contractor shall be paid that amount in accordance with Clause 26 (Interim and Final Certificates). The Project Manager shall notify the Contractor of any determination made under this Clause 23.7 with a copy to the Employer.
clauses.general_condition: When the Project Manager has received the comprehensive account of the claim as required by Clause 23.5 (Comprehensive Claim) and such further particulars and information as he may require under such Clause, the Project Manager shall, after due consultation with the Employer, the Supervision Consultant and the Contractor, determine the amount, if any, to which the Contractor is entitled and the Contractor shall be paid that amount in accordance with Clause 26 (Interim and Final Certificates). The Project Manager shall notify the Contractor of any determination made under this Clause 23.7 with a copy to the Employer.

clauses.clause_text: Before issuing any Interim Certificate or Final Certificate under Clause 26 (Interim and Final Certificates) which includes any amount in respect of work done and/or Plant provided by any Nominated Subcontractor, the Project Manager shall be entitled to require from the Contractor reasonable evidence that all amounts due to such Nominated Subcontractor in respect of work done and/or Plant provided and covered by previous Interim Certificates or Final Certificates, less applicable deductions for retention or otherwise, have been received by such Nominated Subcontractor. Unless the Contractor (a) submits such reasonable evidence to the Project Manager; or (b) (i) satisfies the Project Manager in writing that the Contractor has reasonable cause for withholding or refusing to pay the said amounts (less applicable deductions); and (ii) produces to the Project Manager reasonable evidence that the Contractor has informed such Nominated Subcontractor in writing of that reasonable cause; the Employer may (at its sole discretion) pay to such Nominated Subcontractor direct, upon the certificate of the Project Manager, part or all of such amounts (less applicable deductions) as are due to such Nominated Subcontractor and for which the Contractor has failed to comply with the requirements of paragraphs (a) or (b) above. In such event, the Employer shall be entitled to deduct any amount so paid direct to the Nominated Subcontractor by the Employer from any sums due or which may become due from the Employer to the Contractor or to recover the same as a debt due from the Contractor. Provided that the Employer shall, in no circumstances where it exercises its discretion to pay a Nominated Subcontractor direct as aforesaid, be obliged to pay any amount to a Nominated Subcontractor in excess of amounts available for deduction as set out in this Clause 24.2. Notwithstanding the foregoing, the Employer expressly excludes all liability to the Contractor for any wrongful or incorrect payment direct to any Nominated Subcontractor by the Employer.

clauses.clause_text: If any Extended Warranty is or should be granted by any Subcontractor (whether or not a Nominated Subcontractor), the Contractor shall procure that such Extended Warranty is duly granted:- (a) in such a form as to be capable of enforcement by the Employer and/or the Contractor on a joint or several basis; or (b) in such a form as to be capable of enforcement by the Employer only and as to be capable of being freely assignable by the Employer to any third party; or (c) in such a form as to be capable of enforcement by the Contractor or any assignee of the Contractor. In this event, immediately after expiry of the relevant Defects Liability Period and as a condition precedent to the issue of the Final Certificate under Clause 26.4 (Issue of Final Certificates) in respect of the relevant Section or Portion of the Works, the Contractor shall assign to the Employer absolutely the full benefit of the remaining period of such Extended Warranty and the Contractor shall at all times thereafter upon request of the Project Manager or the Employer execute all such documents and do all such things as may be necessary for vesting in the Employer absolutely or for enforcing for the Employer's benefit the aforesaid Extended Warranty. Each Extended Warranty shall be duly notarised prior to its delivery.
clauses.general_condition: If any Extended Warranty is or should be granted by any Subcontractor (whether or not a Nominated Subcontractor), the Contractor shall procure that such Extended Warranty is duly granted:- (a) in such a form as to be capable of enforcement by the Employer and/or the Contractor on a joint or several basis; or (b) in such a form as to be capable of enforcement by the Employer only and as to be capable of being freely assignable by the Employer to any third party; or (c) in such a form as to be capable of enforcement by the Contractor or any assignee of the Contractor. Each Extended Warranty shall be duly notarised prior to its delivery.

clauses.clause_text: (a) The Project Manager shall, except as otherwise stated in the Contract, ascertain and determine by measurement the value of the Works in accordance with the Contract and the Contractor shall be paid that value in accordance with Clause 26 (Interim and Final Certificates). (b) The Project Manager shall determine the documentation to be used for measurement purposes provided that where the Project Manager considers it necessary to measure any part of the Works on Site, reasonable notice shall be given to the Contractor, who shall: (i) promptly either attend or send another qualified representative to assist the Project Manager (or a person on his behalf) in making the measurement; and (ii) supply any particulars required by the Project Manager If the Contractor fails to attend or send a representative, the measurement made on Site by (or on behalf of) the Project Manager shall be taken as accurate. Wherever the Project Manager determines that any part of the Works is to be measured from records prepared by the Supervision Consultant, the Contractor shall, as and when requested and within the period specified by the Supervision Consultant, attend to examine and agree such records with the Supervision Consultant and shall sign the same when agreed. If the Contractor does not attend within the period specified by the Supervision Consultant, the records shall be taken as accurate. If the Contractor examines and disagrees the records and/or does not sign them as agreed, then the Contractor shall give notice to the Supervision Consultant of the respects in which the records are claimed to be inaccurate. After receiving this notice, the Supervision Consultant shall review the records and either confirm or vary them and notify the Contractor accordingly. If the Contractor does not so give notice to the Supervision Consultant within the said period specified by the Supervision Consultant, they shall be taken as accurate. (c) The Project Manager shall, upon completion of the measurement by (or on behalf of) the Project Manager of any part of the Works, deliver to the Contractor a copy of such measurement for examination and agreement by the Contractor. The Contractor shall, within such period of time after receipt of the said measurement as shall be required by the Project Manager, either sign the same when agreed or notify the Project Manager of those parts of such measurement which are claimed by it to be inaccurate. If the Project Manager receives a notice from the Contractor within the period specified by the Project Manager claiming that parts of such measurement are inaccurate, the Project Manager (or a person on his behalf) shall review such parts and shall either confirm or vary them and notify the Contractor accordingly. If, in respect of the measurement made by (or on behalf of) the Project Manager of any part of the Works delivered to it by the Project Manager, the Contractor does not within the period specified by the Project Manager either sign the same as agreed or give notice claiming that parts of such measurement are inaccurate, such measurement shall be taken as accurate.

(b) The Project Manager shall determine the documentation to be used for measurement purposes provided that where the Project Manager considers it necessary to measure any part of the Works on Site, reasonable notice shall be given to the Contractor, who shall: (i) promptly either attend or send another qualified representative to assist the Project Manager (or a person on his behalf) in making the measurement; and (ii) supply any particulars required by the Project Manager If the Contractor fails to attend or send a representative, the measurement made on Site by (or on behalf of) the Project Manager shall be taken as accurate. Wherever the Project Manager determines that any part of the Works is to be measured from records prepared by the Supervision Consultant, the Contractor shall, as and when requested and within the period specified by the Supervision Consultant, attend to examine and agree such records with the Supervision Consultant and shall sign the same when agreed. If the Contractor does not attend within the period specified by the Supervision Consultant, the records shall be taken as accurate. If the Contractor examines and disagrees the records and/or does not sign them as agreed, then the Contractor shall give notice to the Supervision Consultant of the respects in which the records are claimed to be inaccurate. After receiving this notice, the Supervision Consultant shall review the records and either confirm or vary them and notify the Contractor accordingly. If the Contractor does not so give notice to the Supervision Consultant within the said period specified by the Supervision Consultant, they shall be taken as accurate. (c) The Project Manager shall, upon completion of the measurement by (or on behalf of) the Project Manager of any part of the Works, deliver to the Contractor a copy of such measurement for examination and agreement by the Contractor. The Contractor shall, within such period of time after receipt of the said measurement as shall be required by the Project Manager, either sign the same when agreed or notify the Project Manager of those parts of such measurement which are claimed by it to be inaccurate. If the Project Manager receives a notice from the Contractor within the period specified by the Project Manager claiming that parts of such measurement are inaccurate, the Project Manager (or a person on his behalf) shall review such parts and shall either confirm or vary them and notify the Contractor accordingly. If, in respect of the measurement made by (or on behalf of) the Project Manager of any part of the Works delivered to it by the Project Manager, the Contractor does not within the period specified by the Project Manager either sign the same as agreed or give notice claiming that parts of such measurement are inaccurate, such measurement shall be taken as accurate.

clauses.clause_text: Subject to the provisions of Clause 22.3 (Valuation of Variation Orders) in relation to the valuation of Variation Orders, the rates and prices contained in the Bills of Quantities shall be used in valuing the Works measured in accordance with Clauses 25.2 (Works to be Measured) and 25.3 (Method of Measurement). Where the said Bills do not contain a rate or price for a particular measured item the Employer and the Contractor shall endeavour to agree a suitable rate or price. In the event of failure to agree as aforesaid the Employer shall fix a rate or price which, in his opinion, is appropriate and shall notify the Contractor accordingly with a copy to the Project Manager. The Contractor shall submit to the Employer all such documents, evidence and calculations as the Employer shall require for the purpose of agreeing a suitable rate or price as aforesaid.

clauses.clause_text: When:- (a) at least fourteen (14) days have elapsed after the expiration of the Defects Liability Period for a Section or Portion of the Works and the Contractor has in relation thereto performed all its obligations under Clause 21 (Defects), has finished any work related to the said Section or Portion of the Works which had not been completed at the time of issue of the Taking-Over Certificate in respect thereof, and has to the satisfaction of the Project Manager and the Supervision Consultant observed and performed all its other obligations and liabilities (including without limitation those under paragraph (b) of Clause 5.7 (As-Built Drawings, Operations and Maintenance Manuals) and Clause 25A (Extended Warranties from Subcontractors) but excluding any which have not yet arisen under any Extended Warranty still continuing at the time of submission of the relevant Final Certificate application) relating to the said Section or Portion of the Works on its part to be so observed or performed in accordance with the Contract; and (b) the Contractor has prepared and submitted to the Project Manager in triplicate a final account (together with all such documents and evidence as the Project Manager may require in order to substantiate the same) in respect of the said Section or Portion of the Works which shows and breaks down in such form and with such detail as the Project Manager may require all amounts which in the Contractor's opinion are payable under the Contract in respect of the said Section or Portion of the Works and ’such final account has been adjusted as appropriate and agreed and signed by the Project Manager and the Contractor; the Contractor shall submit to the Project Manager in triplicate a Final Certificate application signed by the Contractor's Representative for that Section or Portion of the Works which confirms the du,e performance of all the requirements of paragraphs (a) and (b) of this Clause. The application for the last Final Certificate shall be accompanied by a written discharge, signed by the Contractor's Representative, confirming that the total of the final accounts for all Sections and Portions of the Works represents full and final settlement of all monies due to the Contractor under or in connection with the Contract.

The application for the last Final Certificate shall be accompanied by a written discharge, signed by the Contractor's Representative, confirming that the total of the final accounts for all Sections and Portions of the Works represents full and final settlement of all monies due to the Contractor under or in connection with the Contract.

clauses.clause_text: Following receipt of each Final Certificate application in accordance with Clause 26.3 (Application for Final Certificates) the Project Manager shall prepare a Final Certificate for the relevant Section or Portion of the Works which shall state the amounts shown by the agreed final account as payable to the Contractor in respect of the said Section or Portion of the Works, shall show the total deduction to be made from those amounts by virtue of payments already made to the Contractor pursuant to Interim Certificates or otherwise and amounts payable to the Employer from the Contractor under any term, condition or provision of the Contract or otherwise in connection with or arising out of the Works including those amounts which the Contract specifically provides shall be recoverable from the Contractor by the Employer as a debt due from the Contractor or may be deducted by the Employer from any monies due or which may become due to the Contractor, and shall show the final nett amounts accordingly remaining payable to the Contractor or the Employer as the case may be. If at the time of preparation of any Final Certificate there is under any term, condition or provision of the Contract or otherwise in connection with or arising out of the Works any amount to which the Project Manager considers the Contractor to be entitled or which the Project Manager considers the Employer or the Project Manager entitled to deduct or otherwise recover from the Contractor, and if such amount does not in the Project Manager's opinion relate specifically to any particular Section(s) or Portion(s) of the Works and has not been included in any previous Final Certificate, the Project Manager shall include the same at the end of the Final Certificate then being prepared as an addition to or deduction from (as appropriate) the figures which would otherwise be the final nett amounts shown by that Final Certificate. Within thirty (30) days after receipt from the Contractor of any Final Certificate application duly completed in accordance with Clause 26.3 (Application for Final Certificates) and provided that all the requirements of Clause 26.3 (Application for Final Certificates) have been performed in respect of the relevant Section or Portion of the Works, the Project Manager shall complete his preparation of the relevant Final Certificate in draft, and submit copies of the same to the Employer and to the Supervision Consultant. Thereafter the Project Manager shall consult with the Employer, the Supervision Consultant and the Contractor as necessary, and when the Employer and the Supervision Consultant agree with the contents of the proposed Final Certificate the Project Manager, the Employer and the Supervision Consultant shall sign the Final Certificate and the Project Manager shall issue it to the Contractor. Provided that if in the opinion of the Project Manager and/or the Employer and/or the Supervision Consultant all the requirements of Clause 26.3 (Application for Final Certificates) have not been performed in respect of the relevant Section or Portion of the Works the Project Manager shall not prepare a Final Certificate but shall, within thirty (30) days after receipt from the Contractor of the Final Certificate application, give written notice to the Contractor specifying in the opinion of the Project Manager and/or the Employer and/or the Supervision Consultant those requirements of the said Clause 26.3 which have not been performed. Once all such requirements have been performed the Contractor shall repeat the submission of the Final Certificate application in accordance with the said Clause 26.3. A Final Certificate issued in accordance with this Clause for any Section or Portion of the Works shall (subject as hereinafter provided) be conclusive evidence of the matters stated in paragraph (a) of Clause 26.3 (Application for Final Certificates), of the final nett amounts remaining payable to the Contractor or the Employer (as the case may be) in respect of the said Section or Portion of the Works, and of any addition to or deduction from those final nett amounts to be made as provided in this Clause provided that:- (i) no Final Certificate shall prejudice the continued validity and enforceability in accordance with its terms of any Extended Warranty or any warranty implied by law in relation to the relevant Section or Portion of the Works or any part thereof; (ii) no Final Certificate shall relieve the Contractor of any and all of its continuing liabilities and obligations provided by the Contract including but not limited to those provided in Clause 12.10 (Inherent Defects) and Clause 15 (Secrecy); (iii) no Final Certificate shall be conclusive evidence as aforesaid if there has been fraud or dishonesty on the part of the Contractor; and (iv) no Final Certificate shall be conclusive evidence as aforesaid with respect to any matter or thing of which either party has either before or within ninety (90) days after the date of issue of that Final Certificate given written notice of dispute to the other party in accordance with Clause 32 (Notices) specifying in detail the matter or thing disputed. The last Final Certificate issued in accordance with this Clause shall, in addition to being (subject as provided above) conclusive evidence of the matters stated above, be (subject as hereinafter provided) conclusive evidence of the performance and observance by the Employer of each and every obligation and liability on the Employer's part to be so performed or observed under or in accordance with the Contract or otherwise in relation to the Works or any Section or Portion thereof provided that the last Final Certificate shall not itself be conclusive evidence of the payment by the Employer of any amount shown therein as remaining payable to the Contractor.

All payments to be made under or in accordance with the Contract or
otherwise in relation to the Works or any Section or Portion thereof shall be

clauses.clause_text: (a) No commission, fee, payment, gift or other benefit of a like or similar kind has been or will in the future be made by the Contractor to any third party (which expression shall without limitation include any consultant, servant, agent, employee, sponsor or distributor of the Employer) in connection with or arising out of the Contract. (b) The provisions of Sub-Clause (a) above constitute a fundamental condition of the Contract and any breach whatsoever thereof shall (notwithstanding the provisions of Clause 30 (Default of Contractor) and Clause 31 (Termination for Convenience and Default of Employer) by the terms of which in this instance the Employer shall not be bound) entitle the Employer at will and entirely in its discretion (and subject to no appeal), to terminate the Contract forthwith and recover damages from the Contractor whether for consequential loss or otherwise. (c) Nothing herein shall prevent the Contractor from making bona fide payments to its Country sponsor or agent in accordance with a properly registered and recorded agreement, or to its employees or Subcontractors.

(b) The provisions of Sub-Clause (a) above constitute a fundamental condition of the Contract and any breach whatsoever thereof shall (notwithstanding the provisions of Clause 30 (Default of Contractor) and Clause 31 (Termination for Convenience and Default of Employer) by the terms of which in this instance the Employer shall not be bound) entitle the Employer at will and entirely in its discretion (and subject to no appeal), to terminate the Contract forthwith and recover damages from the Contractor whether for consequential loss or otherwise. (c) Nothing herein shall prevent the Contractor from making bona fide payments to its Country sponsor or agent in accordance with a properly registered and recorded agreement, or to its employees or Subcontractors.

clauses.clause_text: Notwithstanding any other provision of this Clause 29 (Frustration and Force Majeure), if an event or circumstance outside the control of both parties arises after the date of the Contract rendering in the opinion of the Project Manager performance of the Contract impossible such that under the law governing the Contract specified in Clause 4.2 (Governing Law) the Contract is frustrated then upon notice by either party to the other party of such event or circumstance both parties shall be released from further performance, the Contract shall be deemed to have been terminated under this Clause without prejudice to any rights or obligations which may have accrued due between the parties prior to such termination and the sum payable by the Employer to the Contractor shall be determined and paid in accordance with Clause 29.8 (Payment on Frustration or Force Majeure) however obligations under the Contract which survive such termination including without limitation Clause 12.10 (Inherent Defects), Clause 15 (Secrecy) and Clause 25A (Extended Warranties from Subcontractors) shall continue notwithstanding any such termination.
clauses.general_condition: Notwithstanding any other provision of this Clause 29 (Frustration and Force Majeure), if an event or circumstance outside the control of both parties arises after the date of the Contract rendering in the opinion of the Project Manager performance of the Contract impossible such that under the law governing the Contract specified in Clause 4.2 (Governing Law) the Contract is frustrated then upon notice by either party to the other party of such event or circumstance both parties shall be released from further performance, the Contract shall be deemed to have been terminated under this Clause without prejudice to any rights or obligations which may have accrued due between the parties prior to such termination and the sum payable by the Employer to the Contractor shall be determined and paid in accordance with Clause 29.8 (Payment on Frustration or Force Majeure) however obligations under the Contract which survive such termination including without limitation Clause 12.10 (Inherent Defects), Clause 15 (Secrecy) and Clause 25A (Extended Warranties from Subcontractors) shall continue notwithstanding any such termination.

clauses.clause_text:
If a party is or will be prevented from performing any of its obligations under
the Contract by Force Majeure, then it shall give notice to the other party of
the exceptional event or circumstance constituting the Force Majeure and
shall specify the obligations, the performance of which is or will be
prevented. The notice shall be given within fourteen (14) days after the
party became aware, or should have become aware, of the relevant
exceptional event or circumstance constituting Force Majeure.
clauses.general_condition:
If a party is or will be prevented from performing any of its obligations under
the Contract by Force Majeure, then it shall give notice to the other party of
the exceptional event or circumstance constituting the Force Majeure and
shall specify the obligations, the performance of which is or will be
prevented. The notice shall be given within fourteen (14) days after the
party became aware, or should have become aware, of the relevant
exceptional event or circumstance constituting Force Majeure.

clauses.clause_text: Neither party shall be considered to be in default or in breach of its obligations under the Contract to the extent that performance of such obligations is prevented by any exceptional event or circumstance constituting Force Majeure which arises after the date of the Contract provided that it has given notice to the other party in accordance with Clause 29.3 (Notice of Force Majeure).
clauses.general_condition: Neither party shall be considered to be in default or in breach of its obligations under the Contract to the extent that performance of such obligations is prevented by any exceptional event or circumstance constituting Force Majeure which arises after the date of the Contract provided that it has given notice to the other party in accordance with Clause 29.3 (Notice of Force Majeure).

clauses.clause_text:
The Contractor shall at all times use all reasonable endeavours to prevent
any delay being caused by any exceptional event or circumstance
constituting Force Majeure, to minimise any such delay as may be caused
thereby and to do all that may be reasonably required to the satisfaction of
the Project Manager and the Supervision Consultant, to proceed with the
Works.
clauses.general_condition:

constituting Force Majeure, to minimise any such delay as may be caused
thereby and to do all that may be reasonably required to the satisfaction of
